content.description: The function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> is continuous on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 5, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>. The graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€²</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, is shown above.
content.question: On which of the following intervals is <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> increasing?

choices.label: <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 1, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="open bracket, 2 comma 4, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 1, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="open bracket, 3 comma 5, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 1, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="open bracket, 4 comma 5, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> only

<math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 2, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="open bracket, 4 comma 5, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 2, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="open bracket, 4 comma 5, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
